channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: NAIDOC Week
item.description:
Sunday, July 14, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit all colours to recognise NAIDOC Week.

In the first week of July each year, National NAIDOC Week celebrations are held across Australia to celebrate and recognise the history, culture, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. NAIDOC stands for National Aborigines and Islanders Day Observance Committee. NAIDOC Week is an opportunity for all Australians to learn about Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and histories and participate in celebrations of the oldest, continuous living cultures on earth.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council.

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Diabetes Week
item.description:
Monday, July 15, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Diabetes Week.

Diabetes Australia works to bring about change, by providing a national voice and leadership, while maintaining strong local community connections and engagement. National Diabetes Week (NDW) is one of Diabetes Australia’s flagship annual awareness campaigns held in the second week of July, 14 to 20 July 2024.

This Light Up is organised by: Diabetes Australia.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: State of Origin - Game III Brisbane
item.description:
Tuesday, July 16, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game III Brisbane.

Game III of the 2024 Ampol State Of Origin is in Brisbane and will be the decider for the series. Can Madge’s Blues win at Suncorp and take out this year’s bragging rights or will Billy’s Maroons secure their 3rd consecutive series. This is going to be a BIG one, wear your colours with pride.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of National Pyjama Day
item.description:
Thursday, July 18, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue Pink and White to support Eve of National Pyjama Day.

The Pyjama Foundation provide children and young people in foster care the opportunity to change the direction of their lives with learning, life skills and confidence. Through our Love of Learning program, volunteers called 'Pyjama Angels' are recruited, screened, trained and then matched with a child in care and spend time with them once a week, focusing on learning-based activities. Pyjama Angels read books aloud with their child, play educational games and help children with their homework.

National Pyjama Day (officially held on Friday 19 July, 2024) is all about wearing your favourite pair of PJ's to help The Pyjama Foundation raise much-needed awareness and funds for children in foster care. With the money raised from National Pyjama Day, you’ll be helping us offer learning skills to more than 1000 children, fund educational resources and help provide stable, positive relationships.

This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Anywhere Fringe
item.description:
Friday, July 19, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate Anywhere Fringe.

Anywhere Festivals makes it possible for performance makers to create works anywhere and for audiences to engage with storytelling regardless of access to theatres and experience performances in their community. Anywhere Fringe Brisbane Festival is the fringe festival combining non traditional and traditional spaces across Brisbane from 19 July to 4 August 2024.

This Light Up is organised by: Anywhere Festival.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Qld Reds vs Wales
item.description:
Friday, July 19, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate Qld Reds vs Wales.

Be there at Suncorp Stadium on Friday, 19 July 2024 as our Queensland Reds take on Wales in the first International Tour Match for over 20 years! The Wales match will be a grand revival of the rich history of Queensland sides facing international touring teams. It will be the first clash for the Reds against a major touring nation in two decades since they beat Scotland 41-5 at Ballymore Stadium in 2004.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Colombian National Day
item.description:
Saturday, July 20, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow, Blue and Red to recognise Colombian National Day.

The Commemoration of the Colombian National Day holds great significance for the Colombian community, as it marked a turning point in the struggle for independence and became a defining moment in the birth of the Colombian Nation. By celebrating this we wish to recognize the Colombian community in Brisbane, a vibrant, inclusive and prosperous city which many of our nationals call home.

This Light Up is organised by: Embassy of the Republic of Colombia.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Belgium National Day
item.description:
Sunday, July 21, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Black Yellow Red to recognise Belgium National Day.

On 21 July Belgium celebrates its National Day. This marks the day on which, after Belgium declared independence, Leopold I swore allegiance to the new constitution, thus becoming the first King of the Belgians in 1831.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Consulate of Belgium.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World Fragile X Day
item.description:
Monday, July 22, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support World Fragile X Day.

Fragile X Association of Australia - a national charity providing support, peer connections, information and advocacy for children and adults living with Fragile X syndrome (ie, leading cause of inherited intellectual disability and developmental delay, with links to autism). Each year on 22 July, World Fragile X Day is celebrated in Australia, NZ, the US, India and a range of other countries. The goal is to raise awareness of Fragile X syndrome and its related conditions and to promote support and inclusion for those affected and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Fragile X Association of Australia.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 8 Years to go to the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games
item.description:
Tuesday, July 23, 2024

City Hall will be lit in Olympic colours to celebrate 8 Years to go to the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

23 July 2024 marks 8 years to the start of the Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games. The Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games will create a legacy that aligns with Council’s commitment to making the Brisbane of tomorrow even better than the Brisbane of today.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council.
 

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:summary: 8 Years to go to the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate Anywhere Fringe.

Anywhere Festivals makes it possible for performance makers to create works anywhere and for audiences to engage with storytelling regardless of access to theatres and experience performances in their community. Anywhere Fringe Brisbane Festival is the fringe festival combining non traditional and traditional spaces across Brisbane from 19 July to 4 August 2024.

This Light Up is organised by: Anywhere Festival.

item.title: World Drowning Prevention Day
item.description:
Thursday, July 25, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support World Drowning Prevention Day.

Royal Life Saving Society Queensland is the peak body for drowning prevention and water safety education in Queensland. World Drowning Prevention Day helps to raise awareness and funds to help prevent drownings on an international level.

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Life Saving Society Queensland.

Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Strive to be Kind Day
item.description:
Friday, July 26, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Strive to be Kind Day.

The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation was established in 2014 in memory of Allison Baden-Clay who was murdered by her husband in 2012. The Foundation works to educate and empower the community in the signs of coercive control and domestic abuse. Campaigns and programs have been rolled out through schools, community groups and front line services to support the education and prevention of domestic abuse. Strive To Be Kind Day was established in 2012 to honour and celebrate Allison's life when her family and friends come together to raise funds for the Foundation and share Allison's kindness and generosity to others. The Foundation asks the community to wear a splash of yellow and pay it forward doing random acts of kindness to strangers, friends, family and work colleagues.

This Light Up is organised by: The Allison Baden-Clay Foundation.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of World Hepatitis Day
item.description:
Saturday, July 27, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support Eve of World Hepatitis Day.

Hepatitis Queensland is a values-driven and innovative community organisation that strives to improve the lives of Queenslanders affected by viral hepatitis and liver disease via education, collaboration, and person-centred care initiatives. Our mission is to enable all Queenslanders to live free from the impact of viral hepatitis and liver disease. World Hepatitis Day falls on July 28 each year and is part of a global initiative established by the World Hepatitis Alliance. World Hepatitis Day aims to raise awareness of viral hepatitis and encourage prevention, testing, treatment and management.

This Light Up is organised by: Hepatitis Queensland.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Gambling Harm Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, July 28, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support 2024 Gambling Harm Awareness Week.

Relationships Australia QLD is the predominate deliverer of the Gambling Help Service in Queensland. We work on prevention, early intervention, counselling, crisis support to reduce gambling harms in Queensland. Gambling Harm Awareness Week is held annually each year in late July to raise awareness.

This Light Up is organised by: Relationships Australia Qld.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Donate Life Week
item.description:
Monday, July 29, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Magenta to support Donate Life Week.

DonateLife aims to save the lives of the 1800 patients waitlisted for an organ transplant by encouraging more Australians to sign up as organ and tissue donors and talk to their families. The annual national DonateLife Week encourages Australians to register as organ and tissue donors, helping DonateLife save the lives of those on the transplant waitlist. DonateLife Qld runs events throughout this week.

This Light Up is organised by: Metro Health South

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Rural Fire Services Week
item.description:
Tuesday, July 30, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow to support 2024 Rural Fire Services Week.

Rural Fire Service Queensland has volunteer workforce across the state made up of dedicated people who are ready to support their communities when they are needed. RFS Week 2024 will commence from Sunday 28 July 2024 and run through until Saturday 3 August 2024 and will recognise and highlighted the dedication and commitment of RFSQ volunteers. RFS Week is an annual state-wide celebration held each year in recognition of the critical and invaluable role volunteers perform in emergency service delivery in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Fire and Emergency Services Qld.

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Rural Fire Service Queensland has volunteer workforce across the state made up of dedicated people who are ready to support their communities when they are needed. RFS Week 2024 will commence from Sunday 28 July 2024 and run through until Saturday 3 August 2024 and will recognise and highlighted the dedication and commitment of RFSQ volunteers. RFS Week is an annual state-wide celebration held each year in recognition of the critical and invaluable role volunteers perform in emergency service delivery in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Fire and Emergency Services Qld.

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World Ranger Day
item.description:
Wednesday, July 31, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support World Ranger Day.

Queensland Ranger Association connects people working in protected area management and wildlife conservation across Queensland. We provide networking, upskilling and sponsorship to various events nation and internationally. We raise awareness for fallen Rangers and Protected Area Workers in Oceania and across the globe. We have members from Department of Environment and Science, Great Barrier Reef Authority, local land councils as well as First Nations Land & Sea Ranger organisations. The annual World Ranger Day on July 31st raises awareness each year to reflect on sacrifices and lives lost by rangers around the world and to celebrate the incredible work that rangers, wildlife conservationists and park managers do every day to protect Queensland and the world's natural treasures and cultural heritage.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Ranger Association.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
